text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Mubarak and King Hussein agree they must continue trying to overcome the current crisis in the peace process. The President: The road to peace is long and we are doing all we can so the negotiations can resume.

- The President tells a meeting of the Egyptian political movement: Egypt is responsible for getting the peace process out of its current crisis. Adviser Osama el-Baz will go to Israel today to resume his talks with Netanyahu.
- The "moderate" Khatemi has won Iran's presidency.
- Egypt's youth football squad beat Mali 1-0 and becomes Africa's champion. Mubarak congratulates the team.
- The President: We are doing all we can to reactivate the peace process.
- Israeli television says the United States, the European Union and Jordan all support Mubarak's suggestion to stop settlement building to save the peace process.
- Turnover at the bourse last week was 352 million pounds ($103.7 million).
- Electricity Minister Maher Abaza signs contracts with local firms to build 12 power stations in seven governorates with a total cost of 158 million pounds.

- Mubarak says at a news conference with King Hussein: We are seeking a fair and just solution which the Palestinians will accept. Mubarak makes telephone calls to Palestinian President Arafat, Hussein.
- Israeli television says the government has suggested freezing construction of the Jabal Abu Ghneim settlement.
- Arab League Secretary General Esmat Abdel Meguid says he will only visit Iraq if his trip yields positive results about the Kuwaiti prisoners-of-war.
